title: CitePrompt: Using Prompts to Identify Citation Intent in Scientific Papers. (arXiv:2304.12730v1 [cs.CL])
abstract: Citations in scientific papers not only help us trace the intellectual lineage but also are a useful indicator of the scientific significance of the work. Citation intents prove beneficial as they specify the role of the citation in a given context. In this paper, we present CitePrompt, a framework which uses the hitherto unexplored approach of prompt-based learning for citation intent classification. We argue that with the proper choice of the pretrained language model, the prompt template, and the prompt verbalizer, we can not only get results that are better than or comparable to those obtained with the state-of-the-art methods but also do it with much less exterior information about the scientific document. We report state-of-the-art results on the ACL-ARC dataset, and also show significant improvement on the SciCite dataset over all baseline models except one. tldr: 本文提出了CitePrompt框架，利用提示识别论文中引用的意图，该方法可以通过选择正确的预训练语言模型、提示模板和提示转换器，显着提高分类效果，并且不需要太多外部信息。在ACL-ARC数据集和SciCite数据集上都取得了显著改善。
en_tdlr: The paper proposes the CitePrompt framework, which utilizes prompts to identify citation intent in scientific papers. The method achieves significant improvement in classification accuracy by selecting the proper pre-trained language model, prompt template, and prompt verbalizer, while requiring minimal external information. State-of-the-art results are reported on the ACL-ARC dataset and significant improvement is shown on the SciCite dataset over all baseline models except one.
